concise_definition: n. 便宜货, 协议; v. 讨价还价, 协商

definitions.explanation_en: An item purchased at a price lower than its usual or expected value, often due to a sale or special offer.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指以低于通常或预期价格购得的商品，通常由于促销或特价活动。
definitions.example_en: She scored a real bargain when she bought this designer coat for half price.
definitions.example_cn: 她以半价买下了这件设计师大衣，真是物超所值。

definitions.explanation_en: An agreement or contract between two or more parties, especially one reached after negotiation.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指双方或多方经过协商后达成的协议或契约。
definitions.example_en: The union and management reached a bargain on wages and working conditions.
definitions.example_cn: 工会与管理层就工资和工作条件达成了协议。

definitions.explanation_en: To negotiate the price or terms of a transaction, typically with the aim of obtaining a better deal.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指就交易的价格或条款进行协商，通常旨在获得更优惠的条件。
definitions.example_en: They bargained with the vendor for a lower price on the antique vase.
definitions.example_cn: 他们与摊贩讨价还价，想以更低的价格买下那件古董花瓶。

definitions.explanation_en: To make a deal or agreement, often implying mutual compromise.
definitions.explanation_cn: 指达成一项协议，通常暗示双方做出妥协。
definitions.example_en: After hours of discussion, both sides bargained a ceasefire.
definitions.example_cn: 经过数小时的讨论，双方达成了停火协议。

comparison.analysis: “Deal” (交易) 是一个更宽泛的词，泛指任何协议或交易，不强调价格是否优惠。它可以是商业合作、政治协议或简单的交换。而 “bargain” 作为名词时特指价格低廉的物品，作为动词时强调讨价还价的过程，带有争取利益的意味。
“Negotiate” (谈判) 是一个更正式、更广泛的术语，适用于任何类型的协商，如外交、合同条款或薪资，不一定涉及价格。而 “bargain” 更常用于日常消费场景，语义更口语化，且通常聚焦于价格调整。
“Steal” (便宜货) 在口语中可作名词，指极便宜的物品，与 “bargain” 意义接近，但语气更夸张，带有‘捡了大便宜’的惊喜感。例如：'This phone is a steal at $100!'。而 ‘bargain’ 更中性、常用，适用范围更广。
